name: Champagne B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for a quiet few days away in champagne, and we decided to stay here based solely on the reviews on TripAdvisor. Once again, this website and the reviewers did their job! We arrived quite late, and Bill met us with a warm hello and a quick recommendation to the local restaurant - superb. From there on out, it was just the perfect place. Meredith was away, but Bill kept things ticking over with fresh bread, good conversation, and lots of helpful ideas on where to go and what to do. We decided to bring food back and eat at the B&B with Bill and, on our last night, a really nice couple from Belgium. Much more personal than a hotel restaurant. The facility itself is very clean, with comfortable rooms, plenty of hot water, and superb views from behind the farmhouse onto the valley. The house is a home - and it feels that way. Unfortunately, the pool was being redone, but the piano, guitar and champagne more than made up for it! Bill is also quite the photographer, and took plenty of snaps of us which will be nice momentos for Lauren and I. If you are going to champagne and need access to Epernay, Reims and Paris - look no further. You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Inviting, comfortable, a perfect place from which to explore champagne.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were after somewhere cosy, not commercial, and in a good location from which to explore the Champagne region - this B&B didn't disappoint! It's a beautiful old French farmhouse style building with a big open fire just inside the front door. The rooms are cosy and traditionally furnished which added to our stay. In summer, the courtyard garden would be the perfect spot for a glass or two of bubbly at dusk.
reviews.title: Beautiful base for exploring the Champagne region

reviews.text: The breakfast is brilliant and we both still dream of Bill's fresh bread each morning! Bill and Meredith are always ready to have a chat and you really do feel like you're visiting old friends. Their dinner recommendations were spot on. Unfortunately, I can't remember the names of them but Bill and Meredith will happily make a reservation for you.
reviews.title: Great find in the champagne region!

reviews.text: The B&B was in a great spot to explore - a very scenic 40minute drive from Reims and about 30 mins from Epernay.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

likes.disliked: — The bed not being long enough for people above 2 metres

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended for a romantic getaway!
reviews.title: Champagne Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights recently and it was our fifth visit to the Champagne region and to this B&B. We travel widely around the world, however this is the one place we keep returning to on at least an annual basis. We love the Champagne region and this B&B is perfectly situated to enjoy it. Over the years we have followed many of Bill and Meredith's recommendations for restaurants, tours and champagne houses and we have never been disappointed.
reviews.title: Our favourite B&B - anywhere!

reviews.text: Bill and Meredith are both fascinating company and the rooms are very comfortable. We can't recommend this place highly enough and we are already looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Outstanding hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located West of the Dormans train station, this bed and breakfast is a very nice spot to stop and see the Champagne region. I was hosted by Bill and Meridith, both very intelligent and engaging people with interesting stories. Service and was excellent and Bill went out of his way to accommodate my travel plans or lack there of. Food at the B&B was good and I was fortunate enough to be introduced to some other folks on the road there who were likewise accommodating and friendly. Bill can recommend an outstanding trout restaurant down the road and there is also a Michelin rated restaurant within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and do nothing or explore the French countryside

reviews.text: The building itself is in the middle of renovations which include the indoor pool. There is a hill at the back of the property and a small, unfinished cabin with a great view that overlooks the valley. The rooms are simply decorated but not particularly secure. Bathrooms are appropriately appointed. The beds were a bit unsupportive but not uncomfortable. There is a good sized library including several books about battles in the area. The front of the building supports parking for about four to five vehicles.
reviews.title: Lovely and romantic, perfectly situated to see many wonderful sights.

reviews.text: Altogether I had a great experience, and Bill and Meridith’s help with everything from sights to see to transportation to translation made the overall value an outstanding one. I fully recommend this venue.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed with here as our first stop after flying into Charles de Gaulle. What a great place to relax, recover from the jet lag and recharge the batteries before heading out on our 2 week tour of French and Belgian battlefields. Located in a charming and historic little village (don't blink or you willl miss it), it makes a great base for tours of the Champagne country, day trips into Paris, or just relaxing. I can't say enough nice about the hosts, and there are plenty of good places to eat in the area.
reviews.title: Great place to get acclimated

reviews.text: Always a wrench to leave this B&B because Bill and Meredith make you so relaxed with their easy ways and ever helpful friendliness. Both are bang up to date on current affairs and 'what's on' locally so there is no shortage of things to do and chat about once you return from a hard day's Champagne bagging.
reviews.title: At home in France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is an informal affair around a 'Lazy Susan' table brimming with homemade bread, jams, cheese, yoghurt, coffee and tea. Everyone mixes easily, coming and going, just like a weekend morning at home - it's great.
reviews.title: Perfect Champagne Experience

likes.disliked: — A slight upgrade in cleanliness would improve but owners doing well considering their age

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then it's time to leave, must we go, can't we stay just a day more please?
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a relaxing break after 2 weeks of business in London and Paris, didn't have time to go far and happen to love Champagne so decided this looked ideal. The bonus was they spoke English... after a week of struggling by on schoolgirl French!
reviews.title: Beautiful Region, Beautiful Place, Beautiful People!!

description: Meredith and Bill, a well-traveled American couple, enjoy sharing their four bedroom B&B with guests from around the world. Breakfast conversation is invariably lively. The Champagne B&B is in a 150 year old stone farmhouse situated between forest and vineyards of the Marne River valley, near Epernay and Reims, and an hour east of Paris. It is in the same village, Reuilly-Sauvigny, as a highly regarded restaurant, awarded one star by Michelin.
